005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util;
007
008import java.util.HashMap;
009import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.Objects;
013import java.util.function.BinaryOperator;
014import java.util.function.Function;
015import java.util.function.Supplier;
016import java.util.stream.Collector;
017import java.util.stream.Collectors;
018import java.util.stream.Stream;
019
020import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
021
022@SuppressWarnings("PMD.CouplingBetweenObjects")
023public final class CustomCollectors {
024  /**
025   * An implementation of {@link Function#identity()} that respects non-nullness.
026   *
027   * @param <T>
028   *          the Java type of the identity object
029   * @return the identity function
030   */
031  @SuppressWarnings("null")
032  @NonNull
033  public static <T> Function<T, T> identity() {
034    return Function.identity();
035  }
036
037  /**
038   * Joins a sequence of string values using oxford-style serial commas.
039   *
040   * @param conjunction
041   *          the conjunction to use after the penultimate comma (e.g., and, or)
042   * @return a collector that will perform the joining
043   */
044  public static Collector<CharSequence, ?, String> joiningWithOxfordComma(@NonNull String conjunction) {
045    return Collectors.collectingAndThen(Collectors.toList(), withOxfordComma(conjunction));
046  }
047
048  private static Function<List<CharSequence>, String> withOxfordComma(@NonNull String conjunction) {
049    return list -> {
050      int size = list.size();
051      if (size < 2) {
052        return String.join("", list);
053      }
054      if (size == 2) {
055        return String.join(" " + conjunction + " ", list);
056      }
057      // else there are 3 or more
058      int last = size - 1;
059      return String.join(", " + conjunction + " ",
060          String.join(", ", list.subList(0, last)),
061          list.get(last));
062    };
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * Produce a new stream with duplicates removed based on the provided
067   * {@code keyMapper}. When a duplicate key is encountered, the second item is
068   * used. The original sequencing is preserved if the input stream is sequential.
069   *
070   * @param <V>
071   *          the item value for the streams
072   * @param <K>
073   *          the key type
074   * @param stream
075   *          the stream to reduce
076   * @param keyMapper
077   *          the key function to use to find unique items
078   * @return a new stream
079   */
080  public static <V, K> Stream<V> distinctByKey(
081      @NonNull Stream<V> stream,
082      @NonNull Function<? super V, ? extends K> keyMapper) {
083    return distinctByKey(stream, keyMapper, (key, value1, value2) -> value2);
084  }
085
086  /**
087   * Produce a new stream with duplicates removed based on the provided
088   * {@code keyMapper}. When a duplicate key is encountered, the provided
089   * {@code duplicateHandler} is used to determine which item to keep. The
090   * original sequencing is preserved if the input stream is sequential.
091   *
092   * @param <V>
093   *          the item value for the streams
094   * @param <K>
095   *          the key type
096   * @param stream
097   *          the stream to reduce
098   * @param keyMapper
099   *          the key function to use to find unique items
100   * @param duplicateHander
101   *          used to determine which of two duplicates to keep
102   * @return a new stream
103   */
104  public static <V, K> Stream<V> distinctByKey(
105      @NonNull Stream<V> stream,
106      @NonNull Function<? super V, ? extends K> keyMapper,
107      @NonNull DuplicateHandler<K, V> duplicateHander) {
108    Map<K, V> uniqueRoles = stream
109        .collect(toMap(
110            keyMapper,
111            identity(),
112            duplicateHander,
113            LinkedHashMap::new));
114    return uniqueRoles.values().stream();
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Produces a map collector that uses the provided key and value mappers, and a
119   * duplicate hander to manage duplicate key insertion.
120   *
121   * @param <T>
122   *          the item Java type
123   * @param <K>
124   *          the map key Java type
125   * @param <V>
126   *          the map value Java type
127   * @param keyMapper
128   *          the function used to produce the map's key based on the provided
129   *          item
130   * @param valueMapper
131   *          the function used to produce the map's value based on the provided
132   *          item
133   * @param duplicateHander
134   *          the handler used to manage duplicate key insertion
135   * @return the collector
136   */
137  @NonNull
138  public static <T, K, V> Collector<T, ?, Map<K, V>> toMap(
139      @NonNull Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
140      @NonNull Function<? super T, ? extends V> valueMapper,
141      @NonNull DuplicateHandler<K, V> duplicateHander) {
142    return toMap(keyMapper, valueMapper, duplicateHander, HashMap::new);
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Produces a map collector that uses the provided key and value mappers, and a
147   * duplicate hander to manage duplicate key insertion.
148   *
149   * @param <T>
150   *          the item Java type
151   * @param <K>
152   *          the map key Java type
153   * @param <V>
154   *          the map value Java type
155   * @param <M>
156   *          the Java type of the resulting map
157   * @param keyMapper
158   *          the function used to produce the map's key based on the provided
159   *          item
160   * @param valueMapper
161   *          the function used to produce the map's value based on the provided
162   *          item
163   * @param duplicateHander
164   *          the handler used to manage duplicate key insertion
165   * @param supplier
166   *          the supplier used to create the resulting map
167   * @return the collector
168   */
169  @NonNull
170  public static <T, K, V, M extends Map<K, V>> Collector<T, ?, M> toMap(
171      @NonNull Function<? super T, ? extends K> keyMapper,
172      @NonNull Function<? super T, ? extends V> valueMapper,
173      @NonNull DuplicateHandler<K, V> duplicateHander,
174      Supplier<M> supplier) {
175    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
176        Collector.of(
177            supplier,
178            (map, item) -> {
179              K key = keyMapper.apply(item);
180              V value = Objects.requireNonNull(valueMapper.apply(item));
181              V oldValue = map.get(key);
182              if (oldValue != null) {
183                value = duplicateHander.handle(key, oldValue, value);
184              }
185              map.put(key, value);
186            },
187            (map1, map2) -> {
188              map2.forEach((key, value) -> {
189                V oldValue = map1.get(key);
190                V newValue = value;
191                if (oldValue != null) {
192                  newValue = duplicateHander.handle(key, oldValue, value);
193                }
194                map1.put(key, newValue);
195              });
196              return map1;
197            }));
198  }
199
200  /**
201   * A handler that supports resolving duplicate keys while inserting values into
202   * a map.
203   *
204   * @param <K>
205   *          the Java type of the map's keys
206   * @param <V>
207   *          the Java type of the map's values
208   */
209  @FunctionalInterface
210  public interface DuplicateHandler<K, V> {
211    /**
212     * The handler callback.
213     *
214     * @param key
215     *          the duplicate key
216     * @param value1
217     *          the first value associated with the key
218     * @param value2
219     *          the second value associated with the key
220     * @return the value to insert into the map
221     */
222    @NonNull
223    V handle(K key, @NonNull V value1, V value2);
224  }
225
226  /**
227   * A binary operator that will always use the first of two values.
228   *
229   * @param <T>
230   *          the item type
231   * @return the operator
232   */
233  @NonNull
234  public static <T> BinaryOperator<T> useFirstMapper() {
235    return (value1, value2) -> value1;
236  }
237
238  /**
239   * A binary operator that will always use the second of two values.
240   *
241   * @param <T>
242   *          the item type
243   * @return the operator
244   */
245  @NonNull
246  public static <T> BinaryOperator<T> useLastMapper() {
247    return (value1, value2) -> value2;
248  }
249
250  private CustomCollectors() {
251    // disable construction
252  }
253}
